snippet: It is increasingly clear that we already live in the era of human-induced climate change, with unprecedented weather and climate extremes.
abstract: Professors Christopher R Schwalm, Christopher A Williams and Kevin Schaefer Op-Ed article fears that the 2000-2004 drought in the West could become the new normal; notes that the Northern Hemisphere has just recorded its 327th consecutive month in which the temperature exceeded the 20th-century average and this year had the fourth-warmest winter on record; warns that results will be catastrophic if human-induced carbon emissions are not significantly reduced.

byline.original: By CHRISTOPHER R. SCHWALM, CHRISTOPHER A. WILLIAMS and KEVIN SCHAEFER

lead_paragraph: It is increasingly clear that we already live in the era of human-induced climate change, with unprecedented weather and climate extremes.

headline.seo: Extreme Weather and Drought Are Here to Stay
